intro: Terminalia adamanensis, commonly known as the African snowball tree, is a deciduous tree native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Combretaceae and is characterized by its smooth, grayish bark and large, palmate leaves. The tree produces clusters of small, white, fragrant flowers that bloom in spring, followed by edible, round, red berries. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits. The plant is well adapted to dry conditions and can thrive in a variety of soil types.
